Lady Hawk half laughed. There was a chance thet this bot might see 
the truth yet. "Perhaps then it was the Matrix that brought us 
together. She turned and smiled at Squizzy "You found me so I could 
help you see the truth and I found you to help that truth become a 
reality." She thought of all the good things her father had taught 
her. maybe he could teach this bot the same.

--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> Squizzy::
> 
> She stopped and turned around, looking at LadyHawk. "Me? Why am I 
> here?" She had to think about it.  SInce she was reprogrammed, she 
> had no idea why she even existed.  Her original boards were removed 
> and with it, her mission assignments and logs. She looked at 
LadyHawk 
> with a dishearted look.  "I...I don't know."  She turned and looked 
> back at her papers. She had the feeling of being alone all of a 
> sudden.  She didn't know why she was here or how she even got here 
or 
> what her purpose was.  She just stared at the papers in her hand 
and 
> sighed.  She couldn't even come up with a good reason for her 
> existants. 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > Lady Hawk knew therules of courtesy to well. Her father always 
> taught her
> > that there were two things you didn't argue, religion and 
> philosophy. Both
> > were subjects that held strong beliefs and a debate couldn't be 
won 
> either
> > way.
> > 
> > She checked the results of the cell sample from the new bot 
> (Nighteyes) and
> > wondered about the possibilities it could bring. (What was 
> Nighteyes again?)
> > Another successful aquisition of DNA. She was getting enough 
> samples for her
> > father it would soon be time to return with her prize. the only 
> problem
> > would be to lose her shadow. Or convince her to tag along with 
> her. "If we
> > can divide the DNA samples in a bot then why not thier conversion 
> chips as
> > well?" She pondered the moment. "If a Maximal chip turns a 
> protoform into a
> > Maximal and a Predacon chip turns it into a Predacon then there 
> should be a
> > way to splice the chips together so that there isn't a 
> distinction." The
> > hawkbot stared at the results more intently.  She stood wondering 
> just how
> > to ask the question so Squizzy would think that it's idle 
> conversation
> > instead of possible desertion. "I'm here because I need a place 
to 
> work.
> > What's your reason?"
> > 
> > 
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: <logomorph@h...>
> > To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Monday, October 23, 2000 6:35 AM
> > Subject: Re: hawk and (mon)goose.
> > 
> > 
> > > Squizzy::
> > >
> > > She nodded and checked the bot in the CR.  She pressed a few 
> buttons
> > > and the Chamber extracted a few cells off the bot.  She brought 
> the
> > > sample over to Lady Hawk and set them down on the table in 
front 
> of
> > > her.
> > > "You have a point.  But then again, don't you think the Matrix 
had
> > > this planned out long ago? In order to have balance, the matrix
> > > created both Autobot and Decepticon.  Maximal and Predacon.  
This 
> had
> > > to have happened for a reason. But what that reason is, I am not
> > > sure."  She went back to corner of the room as started looking 
at 
> the
> > > paper work.
> > >
> > >
> > > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> > > > Lady Hawk took it for granted that Squizzy would understand. 
Two
> > > facts were
> > > > relevant to her. "Predacons fight because they are programmed 
as
> > > warriors.
> > > > Maximals fight because Predacons exist." She tried to explain 
> the
> > > source of
> > > > her beliefs but found it hard to put into words without 
> instegating
> > > more
> > > > questions. "I'll take you somewhere where I can make it more 
> clear
> > > to you
> > > > sometime. " she said trying to change the subject. "I have 
work 
> to
> > > do, If
> > > > you wish to assist me you can bring me a sample of this new 
bots
> > > DNA"
